intro: Nigella arvensis var. involucrata, commonly known as the Persian velvet flower, is a flowering plant native to regions of Central Asia and the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces small, spherical seed pods that enclose numerous tiny, dark seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are dark green, slightly hairy, and arranged in a basal rosette. The flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, adding a subtle aesthetic to its ornamental value.
